thread.title: Liverpool v Spurs: Stat shows why Liverpool missed Sadio Mane at AFCON after Spurs double | Metro News
thread.title_full: Liverpool v Spurs: Stat shows why Liverpool missed Sadio Mane at AFCON after Spurs double | Metro News

author: George Bellshaw For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Liverpool v Spurs: Stat shows why Liverpool missed Sadio Mane at AFCON after Spurs double | Metro News
text:
George Bellshaw for Metro.co.uk Saturday 11 Feb 2017 6:22 pm Mane was really missed while on international duty (Picture: Getty) 
Sadio Mane has enjoyed a brilliant debut season for Liverpool and he was at his devastating best as he scored a quick-fire double against Tottenham Hotspur. 
The Senegal international, 24, put Jurgen Klopp’s side 2-0 up inside 20 minutes. Mesut Ozil suffering CRISIS of confidence, admits Arsenal boss Wenger 
There were just 138 seconds between both of his goals and only an excellent save from Hugo Lloris denied him a hat-trick just minutes later. 
Spurs could not deal with him and it’s easy to see he’s been heavily missed while at the Africa Cup of Nations. 
In his absence, Liverpool won only one match, an FA Cup replay against Plymouth and lost five of their seven matches.
